Journal names have been intentionally excluded. Lab member names are in bold. Links are provided to the published article and when possible an open-access version (pre- or post-print) of the paper. Hover over article links for a brief synopsis of the paper. 

Click on a triangle for a brief summary of each paper.

### Preprints

<details>
    <summary>A novel maize kinesin causes neocentromere activity and meiotic drive, altering inheritance patterns across the genome [[YouTube](https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiIk5W14eHSAhVO92MKHbseACgQtwIIHDAA&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DbcCxsVPwOE8&usg=AFQjCNGJ2xxs5xSbskrcavIoJ0D8ve3fjA&sig2=gmS2FYQxQlrQJRw8PGPDFw)]

    <p style="margin-left: 30px">We identify a small gene family Kindr as the causal locus for meiotic drive in maize. 
</p></details>  


<details>
    <summary>Evolutionary responses to conditionality in species interactions across environmental gradients [[preprint](http://biorxiv.org/content/early/2017/03/01/031195)]    
**O'Brien AM**, Sawers RJH, **Ross-Ibarra J**, Strauss SY  </summary>
    <p style="margin-left: 30px">We present the CoCoA hypothesis which describes how patterns of biotic coadpation change across varying abiotic environments   
</p></details> 

### 2018


<details>
    <summary>[Parallel altitudinal clines reveal adaptive evolution of genome size in Zea mays]() [[preprint](http://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2017/07/13/134528)] [[github](https://github.com/paulbilinski/GenomeSizeAnalysis)]  
**Bilinski P**, Albert P, Berg JJ, Birchler JA, Grote M, **Lorant A**, **Quezada J**, Swarts K, **Yang J**, **Ross-Ibarra J** </summary>
    <p style="margin-left: 30px">We show that genome size can be analyzed as a quantitative trait and that selection on flowering time in maize has likely driven adaptive changes in genome size along multiple altitudinal clines. 
</p></details> 

<details>
    <summary>[Adaptation in plant genomes: bigger is different]() [[preprint](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2017/10/02/196501)] [[github](https://github.com/RILAB/AJB_MutationalTargetSize_GenomeSize)]  
**Mei W**, **Stetter MG**, **Gates DJ**, **Stitzer MC**, **Ross-Ibarra J**</summary>
    <p style="margin-left: 30px">We develop the functional space hypothesis in which we posit that adaptation in large genomes uses more noncoding variation and is more likely to proceed via soft sweeps. </p></details>  

<details>
    <summary>[Harnessing cross-border resources to confront climate change]()  
Aburto-Oropeza O, Edwards M, Páramo Figueroa VH, Domínguez S ...[85 authors]... Miles D, Müller J, Lara R, Sawers R  </summary>
    <p style="margin-left: 30px">Discusses the challenges of changing climates pose for society and the environment along the Mexican-US border.</p></details>

<details>

<details>

<details>

<details>
